rComments: Revised 80K was still a bit of a mess. Assignment grades weren't fully updated even until the final week of class (despite having so many TAs) and the TAs are given free reign over the students in their sections. Loved the lectures and guest lecturers but the group assignments were pretty much hit or miss. Prepare to work your ass off on projects.

I hear his 80K class changed this year. His class is organized, but there's more work in terms of several pop quizzes, and three (maybe four) group projects. The pop quizzes aren't too bad. He goes in depth about what he's discussing. There's no textbook; all readings and assigned games are on the class site. The readings are surprisingly heavy.

Such a surprise to have a class tightly organized and at the same time be invited to contribute suggestions to what we will focus on and cover in class. The games we covered were awesome. He has an ability to spark discussion and then stand back and let the students lead the discussion. His project critiques were insightful and helpful.
Terrible professor. Argued about trivial things and had nothing to do with the game project, which was the majority of the class grade.

He is a horrible teacher, I learned more from reading the book. He was gone half the time. There was two interesting guest lectures, but other than that the class is boring. I am a game design major, and I find this class useless. When he was gone, TA's would give lectures and they where HORRIBLE! do not take this class if you don't have to.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS, it is the HARDEST class at UCSC and you WILL regret it! I signed up for this as a GE, and it is the HARDEST class I have taken. I am a math/physics major, and THIS CLASS IS REALLY HARD! WASTE OF TIME

This class is pretty easy to understand if you learn a lot from the textbook and use it. This professor is quite an entertaining one with a balance of basic game concepts, untapped genres/play-styles, and demonstrations of games. The game creation project helps a lot in reenforcing those previous concepts to be innovative from the rest. CSGD FTW!!!

This class is ridiculous. The lectures are a waste of time, covering mundane material  like "What is Play?". You can't skip them either, because there are 4 pop quizzes. The majority of your grade is based on the project [making an original game] with a partner. The lectures don't help/teach you how, and the labs are just as bad.

Super funny guy. His lectures were only boring because they were 2 hours long, otherwise I enjoyed the class a lot. Don't expect it to be easy, the project is VERY time consuming and difficult. The quizzes will hurt your grade if you don't retain a lot of info from the lectures and book. I recommend this class if you are a game design major

He is a cool guy ,but if you arent a game design major stay out of this class. i took it for the gen ed and barely passed it, because the graders expect you to do as well as the game design majors. But if you ask his help he is pretty cool about it so dont believe people that say he doesnt help. He is really clear about the final but not the quiz
Not worth the Gen. Ed.  I just wanted to take the class cause I heard it was a fun and interesting class- not the case! it's boring, hard, and left me wishing I hadn't taken it.

His lectures are extremely boring and 90% of it has nothing to do with the quizzes. A huge chunk of the grade is the project (which he doesn't teach anything about nor does he help with). You're supposed to figure out everything on your own. The classes are a joke! People play games for the first 20 minutes and then he yaps about useless stuff!!
